channel.title: I get an error when running batch file for my java applet
channel.description:
so im trying to run my java applet i made in eclipse from a batch file. let me go through what i have done so far.
okay so i made the applet in eclipse im not using main instead im using init because you have to i believe right?
i made a folder on desktop called Book then i put the BookWriter.class file inside this folder with the batch file next to it. here is the batch file code: [code]@echo off title RSBookWriter java -Xmx512m BookWriter pause [/code]
well every time i run it i get this error: [code]Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: BookWriter Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: BookWriter at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(Unknown Source) at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method) at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) Could not find the main class: BookWriter. Program will exit. Press any key to continue . . .[/code]
what am i doing wrong? i want to be able to run the class file without eclipse and be able to run it from a batch file.

item.title: I get an error when running batch file for my java applet
item.dc:creator: @hadlich4 hadlich4
item.description:
@hadlich4 wrote:

Well i got it running from an html file but when i click the button to make the book.txt file be created it doesnt create it

Read full topic
item.source: I get an error when running batch file for my java applet

item.title: I get an error when running batch file for my java applet
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

An applet does not launch like a regular java program. You must pack it into a jar and sign it properly and run it from a html page.

Read full topic
item.source: I get an error when running batch file for my java applet

item.title: I get an error when running batch file for my java applet
item.dc:creator: @FusionLord FusionLord
item.description:
@FusionLord wrote:

Is the “BookWriter.class” in the same directory as the batch file?

Read full topic

item.title: I get an error when running batch file for my java applet
item.dc:creator: @hadlich4 hadlich4
item.description:
@hadlich4 wrote:

so im trying to run my java applet i made in eclipse from a batch file. let me go through what i have done so far.

okay so i made the applet in eclipse im not using main instead im using init because you have to i believe right?

i made a folder on desktop called Book
then i put the BookWriter.class file inside this folder with the batch file next to it.
here is the batch file code:

@echo off title RSBookWriter java -Xmx512m BookWriter pause

well every time i run it i get this error:

Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: BookWriter Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: BookWriter at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(Unknown Source) at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method) at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) Could not find the main class: BookWriter. Program will exit. Press any key to continue . . .

what am i doing wrong? i want to be able to run the class file without eclipse and be able to run it from a batch file.

Read full topic
